intro: Kibessia galeata var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf kibessia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
